questions.title: Question 1: What is Human-Robot Interaction (HRI)?
options: b. Interaction between humans and computers
c. Interaction between humans and robots
d. Interaction between robots and animals
questions.explanation: Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) involves the interaction between humans and robots, focusing on the design, implementation, and evaluation of robotic systems that effectively communicate and collaborate with humans.

questions.title: Question 2: Why is HRI important?
options: b. It ensures that robots are expensive
c. It enhances the usability, efficiency, and acceptance of robotic systems
d. It reduces the number of sensors needed
questions.explanation: HRI is crucial for the successful integration of robots into various aspects of human life, enhancing usability, efficiency, and acceptance.

questions.title: Question 3: What is teleoperation in HRI?
options: a. Remote control of a robot by a human operator
d. Robots operating without any human input
questions.explanation: Teleoperation involves the remote control of a robot by a human operator, used in applications where direct human presence is impractical or dangerous.

questions.title: Question 4: What is supervisory control?
options: b. Humans giving high-level commands while robots execute tasks autonomously
c. Humans controlling robots in real-time
d. Robots operating independently without any human supervision
questions.explanation: Supervisory control involves humans providing high-level commands while robots execute tasks autonomously, with human intervention only when necessary.

questions.title: Question 5: What type of interaction involves humans and robots working together to complete tasks?
questions.explanation: Collaborative control involves humans and robots working together to complete tasks, leveraging each other's strengths.

questions.title: Question 6: What is a key challenge in designing effective HRI systems?
options: a. Reducing the number of sensors
b. Ensuring clear and effective communication between humans and robots
c. Increasing the cost of robots
questions.explanation: A key challenge in designing effective HRI systems is ensuring clear and effective communication between humans and robots, including natural language processing and gesture recognition.

questions.title: Question 7: What is the role of speech in HRI?
options: b. To allow robots to interact using natural language
d. To build the robot's structure
questions.explanation: Speech allows robots to interact with humans using natural language, enabling them to understand and respond to spoken commands.

questions.title: Question 8: What is a common use of gestures in HRI?
options: c. To convey spatial information and support hands-free interaction
questions.explanation: Gestures are used to convey spatial information and support hands-free interaction in HRI.

questions.title: Question 9: Why are facial expressions important in HRI?
options: b. To convey emotions and intentions
c. To build the robot's structure
d. To control the robot's movements
questions.explanation: Facial expressions are important in HRI as they help robots convey emotions and intentions, creating a more natural and engaging interaction experience.

questions.title: Question 10: What is a key principle of usability in HRI design?
questions.explanation: A key principle of usability in HRI design is simplicity, ensuring that interfaces are intuitive and easy to use.

questions.title: Question 11: What is a primary concern in ensuring safety in HRI?
options: a. Reducing the number of sensors
b. Ensuring predictable and reliable robot behavior
questions.explanation: Ensuring safety in HRI involves making sure that robot behavior is predictable and reliable to avoid unexpected actions that could cause harm.

questions.title: Question 12: What is a key ethical issue in HRI design?
questions.explanation: Privacy is a key ethical issue in HRI design, involving the responsible collection and use of user data.
